settings.name: Start date
settings.description: Start date of the period of interest, formatted as character strings in the form 'mm-dd' (e.g. '05-19' for May 19)

settings.name: End date
settings.description: End date of the period of interest, formatted as character strings in the form 'mm-dd' (e.g. '07-07' for July 07)

settings.name: Fix rate
settings.description: Individuals with a fix rate lower than nfixes per day over the period of of interest are removed

settings.name: Missing data
settings.description: Individuals with a gap in their data (number of days with missing locations) higher than dayloss are removed

settings.name: Restriction
settings.description: If true, only individuals having monitoring for the entire period are considered

settings.name: Number of days in a segment
settings.description: Integer value indicating the minimum number of days between the beginning of the time series and the first BP (calf birth), the last BP (calf death) and the end of the time series, and between the two BPs. The main reason for this constraint is that a minimum number of data points are required in each section of the time-series to be able to estimate model parameters. We recommend 9 relocations (e.g. 3 days at 3 locations / day)

settings.name: Minimum recovery time
settings.description: Lower constraint on the recovery parameter *k*, as the minimum time it takes the female to recover normal movement rate (in days)

settings.name: Maximum recovery time
settings.description: Upper constraint on the recovery parameter *k*, as the maximum time it takes the female to recover normal movement rate (in days)

settings.name: Models
settings.description: Models to be used to determine parturition status and timing between 'calfonly' (comparing only the no calf and calf models) and 'full' (comparing the no calf, calf and calf + death models

references.note: Couriot, O. H., Cameron, M. D., Joly, K., Adamczewski, J., Campbell, M. W., Davison, T., Gunn, A., Kelly, A. P., Leblond, M., Williams, J., Fagan, W. F., Brose, A., & Gurarie, E. (2023). Continental synchrony and local responses: Climatic effects on spatiotemporal patterns of calving in a social ungulate. Ecosphere, 14(1), e4399.
